episode_title: 108 - The One Where Nana Dies Twice
note:
[Scene: Chandler’s Office, Chandler is on a coffee break. Shelley enters.)
 Shelley: Hey gorgeous, how’s it going?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Dehydrated Japanese noodles under fluorescent lights… does it get better than this?

content.speaker: Shelley
content.text: Question. You’re not dating anybody, are you, because I met somebody who would be perfect for you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ah, y’see, perfect might be a problem. Had you said ‘co-dependent’, or ’self-destructive’…

content.speaker: Shelley
content.text: Do you want a date Saturday?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes please.

content.speaker: Shelley
content.text: Okay. He’s cute, he’s funny, he’s-

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: He’s a he?

content.speaker: Shelley
content.text: Well yeah! …Oh God. I- just- I thought- Good, Shelley. I’m just gonna go flush myself down the toilet now…(backs out of the room) Okay, goodbye…

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, everyone is there.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: …Couldn’t enjoy a cup of noodles after that. I mean, is that ridiculous? Can you believe she actually thought that?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Um… yeah. Well, I mean, when I first met you, y’know, I thought maybe, possibly, you might be…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You did?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, but then you spent Phoebe’s entire birthday party talking to my breasts, so then I figured maybe not.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Huh. Did, uh… any of the rest of you guys think that when you first met me?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I did.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, I think so, yeah.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Not me.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Nono, me neither. Although, uh, y’know, back in college, Susan Sallidor did.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You’re kidding! Did you tell her I wasn’t?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No. No, it’s just ’cause, uh, I kinda wanted to go out with her too, so I told her, actually, you were seeing Bernie Spellman… who also liked her, so…
(Joey congratulates Ross, sees Chandler’s look and abruptly stops.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, this is fascinating. So, uh, what is it about me?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I dunno, ’cause you’re smart, you’re funny…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ross is smart and funny, d’you ever think that about him?

content.speaker: All
content.text: Yeah! Right!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: WHAT IS IT?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, I-I d’know, you-you just- you have a quality.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Yes. Absolutely. A quality.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, oh, a quality, good, because I was worried you guys were gonna be vague about this.
(Phone rings; Monica gets it)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hello? Hello? Oh! Rachel, it’s Paolo calling from Rome.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God! Calling from Rome! (Takes phone) Bon giorno, caro mio.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So he’s calling from Rome. I could do that. Just gotta go to Rome.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Monica, your dad just beeped in, but can you make it quick? Talking to Rome. (Showing off to Phoebe and Chandler) I’m talking to Rome.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey dad, what’s up? (Listens) Oh God. Ross, it’s Nana.

content.description: The Hospital, Mr. and Mrs. Geller are there, along with Aunt Lillian. Ross and Monica enter and everyone says hi and kisses.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So, uh, how’s she doing?

content.speaker: Aunt Lillian
content.text: The doctor says it’s a matter of hours.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How-how are you, Mom?

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Me? I’m fine, fine. I’m glad you’re here. …What’s with your hair?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: What’s different?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Nothing.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Oh, maybe that’s it.
(Monica strides over to Ross, who is making coffee, and talks to him aside.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: She is unbelievable, our mother is…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, relax, relax. We are gonna be here for a while, it looks like, and we still have boyfriends and your career to cover.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh God!
(They hug.)
[Cut to the hospital, later. Everyone is talking about Nana.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: The fuzzy little mints at the bottom of her purse.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh! …Yeah, they were gross. Oh, you know what I loved? Her Sweet ‘n’ Los. How she was always stealing them from- from restaurants.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Not just restaurants, from our house.
(The nurse comes out of Nana’s room.)

content.speaker: Nurse
content.text: Mrs. Geller?
(Everyone stands up. Cut to Ross and Monica in Nana’s room.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: She looks so small.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, at least she’s with Pop-Pop and Aunt Phyllis now.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: G’bye, Nana. (She kisses her on the forehead.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Bye, Nana.
(He goes to kiss her but she moves. Monica screams. Ross shouts and stares in disbelief. Monica runs out of the room.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ross!
(Ross runs out too.)

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: What is going on?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Y’know how-how the nurse said that-that Nana had passed? Well, she’s not, quite..

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: She’s not- past, she’s present, she’s back.

content.speaker: Aunt Lillian
content.text: What’s going on?

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: She may have died.

content.speaker: Aunt Lillian
content.text: She may have died?

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: We’re looking into it.
(Monica returns with the nurse and they go into Nana’s room.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I, uh, I’ll go see. (He goes in)

content.speaker: Nurse
content.text: This almost never happens!
(Nana passes for the second time and the nurse pulls the blanket over her. Ross and Monica go to tell the family)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Now she’s passed.

content.description: Central Perk, Chandler, Phoebe, Joey, and Rachel are there.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I just have to know, okay. Is it my hair?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes, Chandler, that’s exactly what it is. It’s your hair.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, you have homosexual hair.
(Monica and Ross enter.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So, um, did she…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Twice.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Twice?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, that sucks!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You guys okay?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I dunno, it’s weird. I mean, I know she’s gone, but I just don’t feel, uh…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Maybe that’s ’cause she’s not really gone.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Nono, she’s gone.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We checked. A lot.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hm, I mean maybe no-one ever really goes. Ever since my mom died, every now and then, I get the feeling that she’s like right here, y’know? (She circles her hand around her right shoulder. Chandler, sitting on her right, draws back nervously) Oh! And Debbie, my best friend from junior high- got struck by lightning on a miniature golf course- I always get this really strong Debbie vibe whenever I use one of those little yellow pencils, y’know? …I miss her.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Aw. Hey, Pheebs, want this? (Gives her a pencil)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Thanks!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Sure. I just sharpened her this morning.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Now, see, I don’t believe any of that. I think once you’re dead, you’re dead! You’re gone! You’re worm food! (realises his tactlessness) …So Chandler looks gay, huh?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Y’know, I dunno who this is, but it’s not Debbie. (Hands back the pencil)

content.description: Nana’s house, Ross, Mrs. Geller and Aunt Lillian are going through clothes.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I thought it was gonna be a closed casket.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Well, that doesn’t mean she can’t look nice!
(They open a cupboard which, amongst other things, contains a chest of drawers)

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Sweetie, you think you can get in there?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t see why not.
(He tries pushing against the chest of drawers. Then he opens one of the drawers and climbs into the closet using that; he falls behind the chest of drawers with a shout.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Here’s my retainer!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica is talking to her father.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: I was just thinking. When my time comes-

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Dad!

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Listen to me! When my time comes, I wanna be buried at sea.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You what?

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: I wanna be buried at sea, it looks like fun.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Define fun.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: C’mon, you’ll make a day of it! You’ll rent a boat, pack a lunch…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: …And then we throw your body in the water… Gee, that does sound fun.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Everyone thinks they know me. Everyone says ‘Jack Geller, so predictable’. Maybe after I’m gone, they’ll say ‘Buried at sea! Huh!’.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s probably what they’ll say.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: I’d like that.

content.description: Chandler’s Office, Shelley is drinking coffee; Chandler enters.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, gorgeous.

content.speaker: Shelley
content.text: Hey. Look, I’m sorry about yesterday, I, um-

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, nono, don’t- don’t worry about it. Believe me, apparently other people have made the same mistake.

content.speaker: Shelley
content.text: Oh! Okay! Phew!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So, uh… what do you think it is about me?

content.speaker: Shelley
content.text: I dunno, uh… you just have a-a…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: …Quality, right, great.

content.speaker: Shelley
content.text: Y’know, it’s a shame, because you and Lowell would’ve made a great couple.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Lowell? Financial Services’ Lowell, that’s who you saw me with?

content.speaker: Shelley
content.text: What? He’s cute!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, yeah… ’s’no Brian in Payroll.

content.speaker: Shelley
content.text: Is Brian…?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No! Uh, I d’know! The point is, if you were gonna set me up with someone, I’d like to think you’d set me up with someone like him.

content.speaker: Shelley
content.text: Well, I think Brian’s a little out of your league.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Excuse me? You don’t think I could get a Brian? Because I could get a Brian. Believe you me. …I’m really not.

content.description: Nana’s Bedroom, Ross is holding a dress out from inside the closet.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: This one?
content.parenthetical: holding a dress out from inside the closet

content.speaker: Aunt Lillian
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I have shown you everything we have. Unless you want your mother to spend eternity in a lemon yellow pant-suit, go with the burgundy.

content.speaker: Aunt Lillian
content.text: You know, whatever we pick, she would’ve told us it’s the wrong one.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: You’re right. We’ll go with the burgundy.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh! A fine choice. I’m coming out. (Starts to climb over the furniture)

content.speaker: Aunt Lillian
content.text: Wait! We need shoes!
(Ross falls back inside)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay. Um, how about these? (Holds out a pair)

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: That’s really a day shoe.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And where she’s going everyone else’ll be dressier?

content.speaker: Aunt Lillian
content.text: Could we see something in a slimmer heel?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, I have nothing in an evening shoe in the burgundy. I can show you something in a silver that may work.

content.speaker: Aunt Lillian
content.text: No, it really should be burgundy.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Mm. Unless we go with a different dress?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No! Nonono, wait a sec. I may have something in the back.
(He finds a shoebox (out of shot), pulls it down and opens it. It is full of Sweet ‘n’ Lo’s.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh my God..

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Is everything all right, dear?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, just… just Nana stuff.
(He reaches up higher and knocks down another shoebox lid. Sweet ‘n’ Lo’s rain down on him)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica and Rachel are preparing to leave for the funeral.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: How we doing, you guys ready?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Mom already called this morning to remind me not to wear my hair up. Did you know my ears are not my best feature?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Some days it’s all I can think about.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi, sorry I’m late, I couldn’t find my bearings.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, you-you mean your earrings?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What’d I say?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hm-m.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Are these the shoes?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes. Paolo sent them from Italy.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What, we-uh- we don’t have shoes here, or…?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Morning. We ready to go?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, don’t we look nice all dressed up?…It’s stuff like that, isn’t it?
(They all leave.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It was a really beautiful service.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: It really was. Oh, c’mere, sweetheart. (Hugs her) Y’know, I think it might be time for you to start using night cream.
(Joey listens to his overcoat for a second and sighs, then notices Chandler watching)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Nothing, just your overcoat sounds remarkably like Brent Mussberger.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Check it out, Giants-Cowboys. (He has a pocket TV)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You’re watching a football game at a funeral?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, it’s the pre-game. I’m gonna watch it at the reception.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You are a frightening, frightening man.
(Rachel steps in a patch of mud)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh no! My new Paolo shoes!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, I hope they’re not ruined.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: God, what a great day. …What? Weather-wise!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I know, uh, the air, the-the trees… even though Nana’s gone there’s, there’s something almost, uh- I dunno, almost life-aff- (Not looking where he is going he falls into an open grave)

content.speaker: All
content.text: God! Ross!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m fine. Just-just… having my worst fear realised…

content.description: The Wake, at the Gellers’ house. Ross is lying on his back, with Phoebe squatting over him, checking to see if he’s injured.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, don’t worry, I’m just checking to see if the muscle’s in spasm…huh.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What, what is it?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You missed a belt loop.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh! No-n-

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, it’s in spasm.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Here, sweetie, here. I took these when I had my golfing accident. (Hands Ross a bottle of pills. Then turns to Monica and pats her hair over her ears)
(Cut to Chandler and a woman, Andrea, reaching for the same slice of meat)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, no-

content.speaker: Andrea
content.text: Sorry- Hi, I’m Dorothy’s daughter.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi, I’m Chandler, and I have no idea who Dorothy is.
(They shake hands. Cut to Ross emerging from a hallway, grinning inanely. He is obviously very stoned)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey, look who’s up! How do you feel?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I feel great. I feel- great, I fleel great.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow, those pills really worked, huh?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Not the first two, but the second two- woooo! …I love you guys. You guys are the greatest. I love my sister (Kisses Monica), I love Pheebs… (Hugs her)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh! That’s so nice…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: …Chandler!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And listen, man, if you wanna be gay, be gay. Doesn’t matter to me.

content.speaker: Andrea
content.text: You were right. (They walk off and leave Chandler.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Rachel. Rachel Rachel. (Sits down beside her) I love you the most.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, well you know who I love the most?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh.. you don’t get it! (Passes out and slumps across her)
(Cut to Joey watching TV in the corner. He makes an extravagant gesture of disappointment.)

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Whaddya got there?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Just a, uh… hearing disability.
content.parenthetical: hides the TV, but he still has an earphone

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: What’s the score?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Seventeen-fourteen Giants… three minutes to go in the third.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Beautiful! (Turns to watch with him)
(Time lapse. A large crowd of men are now watching the game)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Pheebs, could you maybe hand me a cracker?

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Your grandmother would have hated this.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, sure, what with it being her funeral and all.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: No, I’d be hearing about ‘Why didn’t I get the honey-glazed ham?’, I didn’t spend enough on flowers, and if I spent more she’d be saying ‘Why are you wasting your money? I don’t need flowers, I’m dead’.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That sounds like Nana.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Do you know what it’s like to grow up with someone who is critical of every single thing you say?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: …I can imagine.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: I’m telling you, it’s a wonder your mother turned out to be the positive, life-affirming person that she is.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That is a wonder. So tell me something, Mom. If you had to do it all over again, I mean, if she was here right now, would you tell her?

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Tell her what?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How she drove you crazy, picking on every little detail, like your hair… for example.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: I’m not sure I know what you’re getting at.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Do you think things would have been better if you’d just told her the truth?

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: …No. I think some things are better left unsaid. I think it’s nicer when people just get along.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Huh.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: More wine, dear?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, I think so.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Those earrings look really lovely on you.
content.parenthetical: reaches out to fiddle with Monica’s hair again, and realises

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Thank you. They’re yours.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Actually they were Nana’s.
(There is a cry of disappointment from the crowd of men.)

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Now I’m depressed! …(To everyone) Even more than I was.

content.description: Central Perk, the gang are looking at old photos.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, who’s this little naked guy?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That little naked guy would be me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Aww, look at the little thing.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes, yes, fine, that is my penis. Can we be grown-ups now?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Who are those people?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Got me.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, that’s Nana, right there in the middle. (Reads the back) ’me and the gang at Java Joe’s’.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow, Monica, you look just like your grandmother. How old was she there?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Let’s see, 1939… yeah, 24, 25?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Looks like a fun gang. (They all look at each other and smile)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ooh, look-look-look-look-look! I got Monica naked!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Nono, that would be me again. I’m, uh, just trying something.

content.description: Chandler’s Office, Chandler is on a coffee break as Lowell enters.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, Lowell.

content.speaker: Lowell
content.text: Hey, Chandler.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So how’s it going there in Financial Services?

content.speaker: Lowell
content.text: It’s like Mardi Gras without the paper mache heads. How ‘bout you?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Good, good. Listen, heh, I dunno what Shelley told you about me, but, uh… I’m not.

content.speaker: Lowell
content.text: I know. That’s what I told her.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Really.

content.speaker: Lowell
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So- you can tell?

content.speaker: Lowell
content.text: Pretty much, most of the time. We have a kind of… radar.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So you don’t think I have a, a quality?

content.speaker: Lowell
content.text: Speaking for my people, I’d have to say no. By the way, your friend Brian from Payroll, he is.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: He is ?

content.speaker: Lowell
content.text: Yup, and waaay out of your league. (Exits)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Out of my league. I could get a Brian. (Brian enters behind him) If I wanted to get a Brian, I could get a Brian. (Sees him) Hey, Brian.
